focus: President's Day Holiday • RBNZ/AUD CPI Week Ahead • China Stimulus Speculation

headlines: Markets enter holiday-thinned week with focus shifting to Wednesday's twin catalysts: RBNZ meeting and Australian CPI
China stimulus speculation builds as Xi Jinping chairs Politburo meeting
US/Canada markets closed for President's Day/Family Day
EUR consolidates below 1.09 as ECB pushes back on rate cut expectations
JPY holds gains near 153.00 as BoJ March hike pricing firms at 60%
marketFocus.riskSentiment: Mixed: Holiday-thinned liquidity creates choppy price action. Focus shifts to mid-week catalysts (RBNZ, AUD CPI). China stimulus speculation provides modest risk-on support. EUR consolidates below 1.09 as ECB pushes back on dovish repricing. JPY holds post-Takaichi gains near 153.00. AUD and NZD supported by hawkish central bank rhetoric ahead of Wednesday's events.

USD.summary: Dollar range-bound ahead of mid-week data deluge. Markets closed for President's Day holiday. Focus shifts to Tuesday's Empire State Manufacturing and NAHB Housing Market Index. Fed's Bowman, Barr, and Daly speak this week. Dollar caught between soft CPI (Jan) and blowout NFP, awaiting fresh directional catalyst.
drivers: President's Day holiday (markets closed Monday)
Soft CPI (Jan) vs blowout NFP creates mixed Fed outlook
Mid-week focus: Empire State Manufacturing, NAHB Housing Index
Fed speakers: Bowman (Mon), Barr (Tue), Daly (Tue)
First Fed cut priced for July after CPI pushed timeline out

EUR.summary: EUR consolidates below 1.09 as ECB pushes back on dovish repricing. Lagarde speaks Sunday, Nagel speaks Monday. German Final CPI (Tue) and ZEW Economic Sentiment (Tue) in focus. ECB's Kazaks: 'now not time to move rates'. Chancellor Merz rejects eurobonds, limiting fiscal expansion hopes. Range-bound until fresh catalysts emerge.
drivers: ECB pushback on rate cut expectations (Kazaks, Lagarde)
German Chancellor Merz rejects eurobonds support
Tuesday: German Final CPI (exp 0.1% m/m), ZEW Economic Sentiment
EUR/USD consolidating below 1.09, lacks directional conviction
ECOFIN Meetings (Tue) and Eurogroup Meetings (Mon) this week

GBP.summary: GBP remains under pressure after dismal GDP (0.7% y/y vs exp 1.1%) and Manufacturing Production (-0.5%). Tuesday brings UK employment data: Claimant Count Change, Average Earnings, Unemployment Rate. Political uncertainty persists despite Cabinet support for Starmer. GBP/USD testing 1.26 support, vulnerable to further downside on weak data.
drivers: Weak GDP (0.7% y/y vs exp 1.1%) weighs on sentiment
Manufacturing Production fell -0.5%, Business Investment -2.7%
Tuesday: Claimant Count, Average Earnings (exp 4.6%), Unemployment (exp 5.1%)
Political uncertainty persists despite Cabinet support
GBP/USD testing 1.26 support, technical breakdown risk

JPY.summary: JPY holds post-Takaichi rally gains near 153.00 as BoJ March hike pricing firms at 60%. USD/JPY sharp reversal sparked intervention speculation. Monday: Tertiary Industry Activity (exp -0.3% m/m). Tuesday: Trade Balance. Carry trade unwind continues as global yields compress. JPY benefits from risk-off positioning ahead of RBNZ/AUD CPI Wednesday.
drivers: BoJ March hike odds at 60% after Takaichi landslide election win
USD/JPY intervention speculation after sharp reversal from 157 to 153
Carry trade unwind accelerates on compressed global yield differentials
Monday: Tertiary Industry Activity (exp -0.3% m/m)
Tuesday: Trade Balance (exp -0.16T vs prev -0.21T)

AUD.summary: AUD reclaims 0.71 on hawkish RBA rhetoric despite Wednesday's CPI looming as key risk event. Monday: RBA Monetary Policy Meeting Minutes. Tuesday: Wage Price Index (exp 0.8% q/q). Wednesday: CPI (Critical). Bullock and Hauser warnings on inflation persistence support AUD. China stimulus speculation (Xi Politburo meeting) provides additional tailwind. AUD/USD testing 0.7150 resistance.
drivers: Hawkish RBA rhetoric (Bullock, Hauser) on inflation persistence
Wednesday: AUD CPI (Critical) - key catalyst for RBA policy path
Monday: RBA Meeting Minutes, Tuesday: Wage Price Index (exp 0.8% q/q)
China stimulus speculation (Xi Politburo meeting) supports AUD
AUD/USD reclaimed 0.71, testing 0.7150 resistance

CAD.summary: CAD under sustained pressure from Trump USMCA exit threats and BoC's stimulative rates. Markets closed Monday for Family Day holiday. Tuesday: CPI (exp 0.1% m/m), Median CPI, Trimmed CPI, Wholesale Sales. Oil weakness (WTI sub-$70) compounds CAD headwinds. USD/CAD testing 1.43, vulnerable to further upside on weak CPI print.
drivers: Trump considering exiting USMCA, threatens CAD outlook
Family Day holiday (markets closed Monday)
Tuesday: CAD CPI (exp 0.1% m/m), Median CPI (exp 2.5% y/y)
Oil weakness (WTI sub-$70) compounds CAD headwinds
USD/CAD testing 1.43, technical breakout risk on weak CPI

CHF.summary: CHF consolidates after AI disruption safe-haven bid fades. Carry trade disadvantage limits upside despite risk-off positioning. SNB's ultra-low rates (0.00%) make CHF less attractive vs JPY in flight-to-quality flows. EUR/CHF stable near 0.94. CHF caught between safe-haven demand and carry disadvantage, awaiting fresh catalysts.
drivers: AI disruption safe-haven bid fades as markets stabilize
Carry trade disadvantage (0.00% SNB rate) limits CHF upside vs JPY
EUR/CHF consolidating near 0.94, range-bound
CHF benefits from USD weakness but lags JPY in safe-haven flows
No major CHF data this week, driven by external risk sentiment

NZD.summary: NZD strengthens on high-beta risk appetite and RBNZ meeting anticipation. Wednesday: RBNZ Official Cash Rate (exp 2.25% hold), Monetary Policy Statement, Press Conference (Critical). Markets expect RBNZ to hold rates at 2.25% but signal extended pause. Inflation expectations remain firm. Trump-Xi trade truce extension supports NZD. NZD/USD testing 0.62 resistance.
drivers: Wednesday: RBNZ meeting (exp 2.25% hold, extended pause signal)
Inflation expectations remain firm, supporting RBNZ hawkish bias
Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended 1 year, supports NZD
High-beta currency benefits from risk-on positioning
NZD/USD testing 0.62 resistance, AUD spillover strength

bonds.name: FGBL
bonds.summary: Euro Bund consolidates near 129.00 after Friday's flight-to-quality rally. ECB pushback on rate cuts (Kazaks, Lagarde) limits upside. German Chancellor Merz rejects eurobonds, reducing fiscal expansion hopes. BofA lifts Germany 10yr yield target to 3% citing stronger growth outlook. Bunds supported by USD weakness but capped by ECB hawkish rhetoric. Range-bound until fresh catalysts.
drivers: ECB pushback on rate cut expectations limits Bund rally
German Chancellor Merz rejects eurobonds support
BofA lifts Germany 10yr yield target to 3% on stronger growth outlook
Bunds supported by USD weakness and stable ECB policy
Range-bound near 129.00, awaiting Tuesday's German ZEW data

bonds.name: ZN
bonds.summary: US Treasury 10yr consolidates near 4.10% after Friday's stellar 30yr auction (2.1bps stop-through). Markets closed Monday for President's Day. Soft CPI (Jan) vs blowout NFP creates mixed Fed outlook, first cut priced for July. Mid-week focus: Empire State Manufacturing (Tue), NAHB Housing Index (Tue). Fed speakers: Bowman (Mon), Barr (Tue), Daly (Tue). Yields range-bound awaiting fresh data.
drivers: Stellar 30yr auction Friday (2.1bps stop-through, largest since April 2025)
Soft CPI (Jan) vs blowout NFP creates mixed Fed outlook
President's Day holiday (markets closed Monday)
Mid-week focus: Empire State Manufacturing, NAHB Housing Index
Fed speakers: Bowman, Barr, Daly provide policy guidance
